alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 8:27PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a ice jam is continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Illinois, including Rock Island county. * WHEN...Until 830 PM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...An ice jam has resulted in some homes and other structures being impacted by high river levels along the Rock River in Rock Island county. Depending on ice behavior, any release of the ice jam could result in sudden rises of water, leading to a rapid flooding situation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 808 PM CST, the latest report from local law enforcement this evening reported ongoing high water in the area and minor flooding across the warned area. An ice jam is occurring and may continue to cause a flooding threat, thus the warning will continue through Tuesday evening. However, if the river continues to recede, the warning may be cancelled or allowed to expire early. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Silvis and Coal Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
